WikiAdventure Documentation

Version 1.0

About

An experimental adventure game framework based on the Wiki principles, where everyone can edit, add and remove contents.

Resources

  • Original outline of the idea.
  • Website that contains the dialog data.
  • A forum thread discussing the project..

Previous Versions

Notice: WikiAdventure was entitled WikiDialog Reader prior to version 0.4.

  • WikiAdventure Version 0.4
    xx. June 2005.

    Download: WikiAdventure 0.4 [xx kB].

    Change log:
    • The source code has grown to more than six times the size of version 0.3, so listing the changes really dosn't make any sense.

  • WikiDialog Reader Version 0.3
    3. June 2005.

    Download: WikiDialog Reader 0.3 [2234 kB].

    Change log:
    • Added Doxygen documentation.
    • Changed the directory structure to the structure outlined here.
    • Added project solution files for Visual C++ 6.0, Visual C++ 7.0 (.NET 2002) and Visual C++ 9.0 (.NET 2005 Express Beta 1).
    • Added a function to dump the entire dialog structure to a XML file. See CDialogHandler::DumpToXML().
    • Implemented dialog that span several different subpages.
    • Fixed a text seaching bug in GetTaggedText() and GetTaggedTextArray() in Util.h.
    • Added new functions to Util.h; RemoveFromText(), ReplaceInText(), GetAfterLast() and GetUntilLast();
    • Added feature that makes it possible to launch the application directly from clicking a website-link.
    • Added a feature to download files from the internet to a local directory. Files already in the local directory will not be downloaded again.
    • Some minor tweaks and additions.

  • WikiDialog Reader Version 0.2
    28. May 2005.

    Download: WikiDialog Reader 0.2 [22.8 kB].

    Change log:
    • Cleaned up the code.
    • Added the CDialogHandler class.
    • Dialog block can have an ID-tag.
    • Reading dialog parameters such as "speaker", "type" etc..
    • Being able to load multiple dialog blocks on each page.
    • Being able to call other block of dialog from scripts. *
    • Dialog can be spead across several different subpages. *
    • Basic scripting using Lua scripts to handle events. *

      Star (*) means supported, but not yet implemented.

  • WikiDialog Reader Version 0.1
    26. May 2005.

    WikiDialog Reader 0.1 [18.5 kB].

    Change log:
    • Initial public release.
